decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize fast and aggressive goblin creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By combining creature buffs like Reckless Bushwhacker and Legion Loyalist with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Goblin Grenade, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently and effectively. Additionally, cards like The Flame of Keld and Light Up the Stage help with card advantage and keeping up the pressure on the opponent. The deck is focused on maintaining a high tempo and finishing the game swiftly.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo involving Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana, allowing for a variety of toolbox options to be searched for and utilized with cards like Finale of Devastation and Eladamri's Call. The creatures in the deck serve as a toolbox, providing various abilities and interactions to help the combo succeed and control the game. By utilizing the tutor effects and the combo pieces effectively, the deck is able to adapt to different situations and win through a variety of means.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to quickly ramp up mana, allowing for big plays with powerful colorless spells like Karn Liberated, Karn, the Great Creator, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck utilizes control elements such as Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt opponents while generating card advantage with Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying. The end game plan is to dominate the board with large threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Kozilek, Butcher of Truth, eventually overwhelming the opponent for victory.

The main concept of this deck is to mill cards from the library into the graveyard, allowing for powerful graveyard synergies to be utilized. By utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Life from the Loam, players can fill up their graveyard with creatures like Bloodghast and Narcomoeba, triggering powerful effects and bringing them back onto the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents by quickly assembling an army of creatures through dredging and utilizing the graveyard as a resource. Cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam also provide additional value when milled into the graveyard.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler, powered out quickly with cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and stubborn denial to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has strong control elements with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ranger-Captain of Eos to slow down the opponent's plays. The deck also has access to great removal options like Path to Exile, Fatal Push, and Dismember to deal with threats. Additionally, the deck has graveyard synergy with cards like Thought Scour, Unearth, Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, and Snapcaster Mage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, while utilizing cards like Bridge from Below and Altar of Dementia to create a powerful board state. By dredging cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, the deck can easily bring back powerful creatures like Bloodghast and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of graveyard recursion and explosive combos, making it a formidable opponent in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to gain life quickly and efficiently through cards like Soul Warden, Soul's Attendant, and Martyr of Sands. This life gain triggers abilities on cards like Serra Ascendant and Ajani's Pridemate, allowing them to quickly become powerful threats. The deck also utilizes white token generation spells like Spectral Procession and Squadron Hawk to pressure the opponent's life total. With the help of cards like Proclamation of Rebirth and Ranger of Eos, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence while keeping its own life total high.

The main idea of this Merfolk aggro deck is to quickly build up a board presence of powerful Merfolk creatures, supported by Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident. By using cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas to disrupt the opponent's strategy and tempo, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while controlling the battlefield with cards such as Merfolk Trickster and Mistcaller. Force of Negation provides additional protection and disruption, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive tempo and secure victory.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's mana base by destroying their lands and locking them out with cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon. It aims to ramp up quickly with mana dorks like Arbor Elf and Birds of Paradise, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures such as Goblin Rabblemaster and Thundermaw Hellkite. The deck can also finish off the opponent with powerful finishers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Stormbreath Dragon. The goal is to control the game through land destruction and aggressive threats to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive board presence using a variety of powerful Human creatures along with disruptive spells like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption while utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play at instant speed. The mana base is designed to support the deck's low curve and maximize consistency. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to attack early and often, leveraging the synergies between its Human creatures to quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly build a strong board presence and deal damage to the opponent's life total. By deploying cheap creatures like Memnite and Ornithopter, along with powerful artifacts like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. With the ability to pump up creatures with Arcbound Ravager and Master of Etherium, as well as direct damage spells like Galvanic Blast, the deck can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on applying early pressure with creatures while disrupting opponents' game plans with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. It also utilizes mana denial strategies with cards like Ghost Quarter and Field of Ruin. The deck includes synergies like Flickerwisp and Restoration Angel to create additional value from enters-the-battlefield effects. Giver of Runes and Ranger-Captain of Eos provide protection and search for key cards, while Path to Exile offers removal. The deck aims to control the board and overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive tactics.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana through cost-reducing creatures like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer, as well as utilizing rituals like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual. By casting a series of spells, the deck aims to assemble a critical mass of cards in the graveyard to enable a powerful combo turn using Past in Flames. Gifts Ungiven allows the player to search for key combo pieces, while cards like Serum Visions and Opt help with card selection. The win condition is typically through casting Grapeshot multiple times to deal lethal damage to the opponent.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to consistently deal damage quickly to the opponent through fast spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing efficient burn spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lightning Bolt, along with effective creatures like Eidolon of the Great Revel, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The mana base is streamlined to support the aggressive game plan, allowing for consistent plays and minimizing disruption to the game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying threats such as Eldrazi Mimic, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to control the game and shut down opposing strategies. The deck also includes efficient removal like Dismember and land destruction with Ghost Quarter. With a mana base optimized for Eldrazi creatures, this aggressive deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board advantage to secure a victory in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It then uses control elements like Condescend, Remand, and Repeal to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and searching for key pieces with Thirst for Knowledge and Expedition Map. The win conditions include powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Wurmcoil Engine, as well as the ability to lock the opponent out of the game with Mindslaver. The deck aims to control the game state and overpower the opponent with its superior late-game threats.
